meanings.sent1: I prelive in the old house before we moved to the new one.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaurs prelive on Earth long before humans.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog preliving in my dreams is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her memories prelive in the corners of her mind, waiting to be rediscovered.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins prelive in the heart of the dense jungle, untouched by time.

meanings.sent1: Legends say that mystical creatures prelive in the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent2: The ancient manuscripts prelive in the library archives, waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent3: The thought of aliens preliving on Mars is a fun idea for a sci-fi movie.
meanings.sent4: The echoes of the past prelive in the walls of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization's artifacts prelive in the museum, telling stories of bygone eras.

meanings.definition: To precede in time or order
meanings.sent1: The appetizers prelive the main course at the fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The morning sun prelives the start of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The early bird prelives the worm, but the late riser gets the coffee.
meanings.sent4: The opening act prelives the headlining performance at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflakes prelive the arrival of winter, painting the world in white.
